name: Limestone, at mine
description:
Limestone mining is quarried from open pits by blasting, followed by mechanical crushing and screening.
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.
category: 21: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction/2123: Nonmetallic Mineral Mining and Quarrying

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Limestone mining is quarried from open pits by blasting, followed by mechanical crushing and screening.

sources.name: Franklin Associates (2004) Limestone Mining & Lime Production

dataGenerator.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

publication.name: Franklin Associates (2004) Limestone Mining & Lime Production

processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.

exchanges.description: The quantity of limestone-containing material per unit of crushed and screened limestone is unknown. The non-limestone material recovered from limestone processing is returned to the mining site. This quantity represents minimum amount of limestone extracted/kg limestone output
